content.description: Discover key concepts with 9 lessons in the Fundamentals module for cryptocurrencies.

lessons.title: The Evolution of Money
lessons.explanation: A discussion of the history of money, the problems it solves, and how cryptocurrency fits into the picture. This lesson will provide a foundation for understanding the motivations behind the creation of cryptocurrency.

lessons.title: Cryptography Basics
lessons.explanation: An introduction to the cryptographic principles that underpin cryptocurrency, including public and private key encryption, digital signatures, and hashing algorithms. This lesson will provide a basic understanding of how secure transactions are made using cryptocurrency.

lessons.title: Consensus Mechanisms
lessons.explanation: An exploration of the different consensus mechanisms that are used to validate transactions on a blockchain, including Proof of Work, Proof of Stake, and Delegated Proof of Stake. This lesson will provide an understanding of the tradeoffs involved in each mechanism, and how they impact the security and scalability of a blockchain.

lessons.title: Altcoins and Forks
lessons.explanation: An explanation of altcoins and forks, including how they are created, their purpose, and their relationship to Bitcoin. This lesson will cover the different types of altcoins and forks, and their potential impact on the cryptocurrency ecosystem.

lessons.title: Cryptocurrency Economics
lessons.explanation: A discussion of the economic principles that govern the cryptocurrency market, including supply and demand, inflation, and market cycles. This lesson will provide insights into the factors that drive cryptocurrency prices, as well as the risks and opportunities of investing in the market.

lessons.title: Understanding Whitepapers
lessons.explanation: * A guide to reading and understanding cryptocurrency whitepapers, including the structure, content, and key takeaways. This lesson will provide tips on how to evaluate the potential of a cryptocurrency project, and what to look for in a whitepaper.

lessons.title: Decentralized Applications
lessons.explanation: An exploration of decentralized applications (dApps), including their architecture, functionality, and potential use cases. This lesson will provide an understanding of the benefits and challenges of building and using dApps, and their potential impact on industries beyond finance.

lessons.title: Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)
lessons.explanation: An introduction to non-fungible tokens (NFTs), including what they are, how they work, and their potential use cases. This lesson will explore the unique properties of NFTs, such as their ability to represent digital ownership and scarcity, and their potential to revolutionize industries beyond art and collectibles. The lesson will also cover the technical aspects of creating and trading NFTs, as well as the ethical and environmental considerations surrounding their use.

lessons.title: Security Best Practices
lessons.explanation: A guide to best practices for securing cryptocurrency, including the importance of strong passwords, two-factor authentication, and cold storage. This lesson will provide practical tips for keeping cryptocurrency assets safe, and how to avoid common security pitfalls.

questions.content: Every SwiftUI app has exactly one scene to which contains a view hierarchy.
How can you customize the display and behaviour of a view in SwiftUI?
answers: Conform it to the appropriate delegate protocol

questions.content: Which of the following allows you to display a table?
You can define custom paths to create shapes in SwiftUI.

answers: You can add SwiftUI views to a storyboard-based app using hosting controllers
You can add UIKit views to a SwiftUI project using representable objects
SwiftUI and UIKit are separate, and shouldn't be integrated
